Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Replace permalink workaround with GitHub advisory permalink field" (#8088) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Field is now available in GitHub GraphQL API, so using it now and removing extension method.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2890

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search] Investigate how to use recent downloads from statistics pipeline" (#8083) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Search] Ramp up on NDCG" (#8082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "GitHubIndexer is failing to find rate limit reset header (X-RateLimit-Reset)" (#7987) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Describe the bug

GitHubIndexer in DEV is failing with this error:
```
System.IO.InvalidDataException: X-RateLimit-Reset is required to compute the throttling time.
```

### To Reproduce

Run the GitHubIndexer job.

### Expected behavior

We should see the `X-Ratelimit-Reset` headers as the same as `X-RateLimit-Reset`.

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/81586075-e28d9480-9369-11ea-9902-d847c89b80b7.png)


### Additional context

Per HTTP spec, we should treat HTTP headers as case-insensitive.

Events.RelatedBody: Make the field sortable to be able to rebuild the search index to support future changes

Fix to make the GitHub Indexer Job handle http headers in a case-insensitive way.

Changes:
- GitHub API response in the SearchWrapper now handles headers in a case-insensitive way #7987 

Progress:
- [x] Merge RI: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/899
- [x] DEV
- [x] INT
- [x] PROD

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Document search jobs " (#8005) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: `db2auxiliarysearch`, `auxiliary2azuresearch`, `catalog2azuresearch`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Package Renames] Reduce popularity transfer propagation times" (#7911) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Popularity transfers depend on the following things to propagate to search:

* auxiliary2azuresearch job - This recalculates the packages' popularity scores and saves the popularity transfers to an auxiliary file. This runs once every 30 minutes.
* Search auxiliary files reload - This reloads the popularity transfers information, which is what the Gallery uses to detect whether a popularity transfer has propagated to search. This runs once every hour.

As a result, it may take up to 1.5 hours for popularity transfers to fully take effect. We increase the job and reload cadences to speed up popularity transfers.

This issue must be done before we can add the end-to-end tests: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7904

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Package Renames] Add message for pending popularity transfers on "Manage Package" page" (#7910) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Popularity transfer may take over an hour to propagate to search. The customers should see an alert on the "Manage Package" page that the popularity transfers are pending.

Depends on:
* [NuGetGallery#7908](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7908) - Add Package Renames form to "Manage Package" page
* [NuGetGallery#7903](https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7903) - Expose popularity transfers in search

The work to "speed up" popularity transfers is tracked by: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7911

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Package Renames] Add Gallery API for end-to-end testing" (#7909) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The end-to-end tests should be able to use the Gallery API to rename a package.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Package Renames] Add Package Renames form to "Manage Package" page" (#7908) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The "Manage Package" page should have a new form to rename packages:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/79151662-b0474200-7d7f-11ea-96c6-f97362afbbcf.png)

The following pieces are tracked in separate issues:
* The message for pending popularity transfers. Tracked by: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7910
* Add the "Learn more" documentation link. Tracked by: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7943

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Package Renames] Add end-to-end test" (#7904) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Test that the package rename feature works as expected:

1. Upload a package
1. Rename it using the Gallery API
1. Check that search API lists its renames

This depends on:
* [NuGetGallery#7909](https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7909) - Add Gallery API for end-to-end testing
* [NuGetGallery#7903](https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7903) - Expose popularity transfers in search
* [NuGetGallery#7911](https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7911) - Reduce popularity transfer propagation times
    * This is necessary as it takes up to 1.5 hours to propagate popularity transfers

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "OutputConsoleLogger should not call affinitized methods in MEF constructors" (#9591) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We should avoid affinitized methods in MEF https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/85211a7bbf93939d713f52522d897fece2bec9d9/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Common/OutputConsoleLogger.cs#L61-L71

See: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2540

The problem here is that we attach listeners in the initialization. 

From: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9663

OutputConsoleLogger is accessing main thread during construction, which is not a good pattern. As it is MEF-composed object, we cannot convert to "private-ctor-public-async-factory" model, so we should lazily initialize OutputConsole outside the constructor.

cc @srdjanjovcic

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "OutputConsoleLogger should not call affinitized methods in MEF constructors" (#9591) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We should avoid affinitized methods in MEF https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/85211a7bbf93939d713f52522d897fece2bec9d9/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Common/OutputConsoleLogger.cs#L61-L71

See: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2540

The problem here is that we attach listeners in the initialization. 

From: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9663

OutputConsoleLogger is accessing main thread during construction, which is not a good pattern. As it is MEF-composed object, we cannot convert to "private-ctor-public-async-factory" model, so we should lazily initialize OutputConsole outside the constructor.

cc @srdjanjovcic

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Invalid package in non-active TFM can cause packages subtree to be empty" (#9741) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
(Copied from https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/6311)

**Visual Studio Version**: Version 16.7.0 Preview 4.0 [30228.12.master]

Works in 16.6.2.

- Have a multi-target project.
- Add a reference conditionally to the non-active (i.e. non-first) TFM
- Use an invalid version number for that reference

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

    <PropertyGroup>
        <TargetFrameworks>net48;net5</TargetFrameworks>
    </PropertyGroup>

    <ItemGroup Condition=" '$(TargetFramework)' == 'net5' ">
        <PackageReference Include="Newtonsoft.JSON" Version="100.100.100" />
    </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

Result is that the "Packages" node shows a chevron to expand, yet no children are presented, which should never happen:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/350947/85969366-c5408280-ba0a-11ea-8e5e-f1466dbe45a3.png)

When expanding the "Packages" node, this exception is raised:

> Could not find project item with item type 'PackageReference' and include value 'Newtonsoft.JSON'.

<details>
<summary>Stack trace</summary>

```

 	WindowsBase.dll!MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.SubclassWndProc(System.IntPtr hwnd, int msg, System.IntPtr wParam, System.IntPtr lParam)	Unknown
```

</details>

The exception is being thrown when `NuGet.VisualStudio.SolutionExplorer.PackageReferenceAttachedCollectionSourceProvider` attempts to inspect the `Version` property of the `IVsHierarchyItem`'s browse object.

This results in the item not being displayed in the tree.

The problem here is that the DTE view of the project only includes the active TFM. Nodes for non-primary TFMs currently may not be present in the project instance.

We can make handle the exception gracefully which will allow the child to appear, however it will still not function correctly. For example, the diagnostic child item will not be displayed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Consolidate tab should use the same caches as the installed/update tab" (#9675) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Reduce NuGetVersion/VersionRange memory leak caused with PM UI" (#9757) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Reproduce: 
1. Open solution in "Experimental  Instance".
2. Open PM UI go to "Browse", "Updates", "Consolidate" tabs then close it. Next close whole project.
3.  As you can see 2 attached images there are 3228 pcs of `NuGetVersion` and 1748 pcs of `VersionRange` items are stayes even though PM UI is closed. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/86664932-06eda200-bfa4-11ea-82e5-7ffcc543f64c.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/86665171-3f8d7b80-bfa4-11ea-9a05-538b4ef4e9be.png)

4.  Repeat from 1 to 2. As you can see below `NuGetVersion` number increased from 3228 to 4260 and `VersionRange` number increased from 1748 to 3491.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/86667205-41583e80-bfa6-11ea-969c-704452d438b7.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/86667277-546b0e80-bfa6-11ea-8b53-de63f6e43b24.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "With multi targeted projects, NuGet should read the target framework related information from the inner build. " (#9756) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently in command line scenarios NuGet reads the target framework information in the outer build. 
That is incorrect because the the contract is that we should depend on on TargetFrameworkIdentifier and the like properties. 
We do that here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/bd482514a87a0085f8eb8603842ee1cb3ca5f277/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.targets#L500-L526

This task is a blocker for https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5154. 

An incomplete list of things that need done are:

* In command line scenarios, read the framework in the inner build (this should allow us to read OS Version for example). 
* In VS scenarios, modify the VSSOlutionREstoreService to read the information from the properties back instead of the TargetFrameworks value. 
* Reflect all of the changes in the assets file (not sure if we'll need any).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VS extensibility APIs required to unblock net5 TFMs with platform identifiers" (#9748) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Investigate existing VS extensibility APIs related to framework parsing, framework names, etc, to understand how other (official) VS components use NuGet and how they'll be impacted for net5.0 TFMs with a platform identifier.

Once this is understood, design and implement new APIs to unblock usage of TFMs with TPI's in VS.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Code redundancy in NuGet client code XmlUtility.cs" (#9091) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
While working on a ADO task observed that `XmlUtility` class is coded in 4 different places in NuGet client code. Good to remove code redundancy as part of engineering improvements work. 

$\NuGet.Client\src\NuGet.Core\NuGet.PackageManagement\Utility\XmlUtility.cs
$\NuGet.Client\src\NuGet.Clients\NuGet.VisualStudio.Implementation\Utility\XmlUtility.cs
$\NuGet.Client\src\NuGet.Core\NuGet.Configuration\Utility\XmlUtility.cs
$\NuGet.Client\src\NuGet.Core\NuGet.Packaging\PackageCreation\Utility\XmlUtility.cs

/cc @aortiz-msft

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
